text: Thomas Reilly Donahue (born September 4, 1928 died February 18, 2023) is an American lawyer and labor organizer. He was Secretary-Treasurer of the AFL–CIO from 1979 to 1995. He was President of the AFL–CIO for a short time in 1995, and President Emeritus since 1996.AFL-CIO biography Donahue was born in New York City. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1928 births Category:Living people Category:Lawyers from New York City Category:American political activists Category:Businesspeople from New York City
title: Thomas R. Donahue
